GeneticAlgorithm.IChromosome< TGene >

GeneticAlgorithm.IChromosome< TGene > Interface Template Reference

An interface of a chromosome. More...

List of all members.

Public Member Functions

void Initialize ()
 Initializes the chromosome.
void Evaluate ()
 The evaluation function.

The evaluation function, or objective function, provides a measure of performance with respect to a particular set of parameters.

The evaluation of a string representing a set of parameters is independent of the evaluation of any other string.

void FitnessFunction (double averageEvaluation)
 The fitness function.

The fitness function transforms that measure (measure provided by the evaluation function) into an allocation of reproductiove opportunities.

The fitness of that string, however, is always defined with respect to other members of the current population.

In the caconical genetic algorithm, fitness is defined by: f_i / f_avg where f_i is the evaluation associated with string i and f_avg is the average evaluation of all the strings in the population. Fitness can be assigned based on a string's rank in the population or by sampling methods, such as tournament selection.

void Crossover (IChromosome< TGene > parent2, out IChromosome< TGene > offspring1, out IChromosome< TGene > offspring2, double crossoverRate)
 The crossover operator.

Crosses the chromosome over with some other chromosome to create (two) offsprings with some probability p_c.

void Mutate (double mutationRate)
 The mutation operator.

Mutates the chromosome.

Crosses the chromosome over with some other chromosome to create (two) offsprings with some probability p_c.

offspring2 The second offspring.

The evaluation function.

The evaluation function, or objective function, provides a measure of performance with respect to a particular set of parameters.

The evaluation of a string representing a set of parameters is independent of the evaluation of any other string.

template<TGene >
void GeneticAlgorithm.IChromosome< TGene >.FitnessFunction ( double  averageEvaluation  ) 

The fitness function.

The fitness function transforms that measure (measure provided by the evaluation function) into an allocation of reproductiove opportunities.

The fitness of that string, however, is always defined with respect to other members of the current population.

In the caconical genetic algorithm, fitness is defined by: f_i / f_avg where f_i is the evaluation associated with string i and f_avg is the average evaluation of all the strings in the population. Fitness can be assigned based on a string's rank in the population or by sampling methods, such as tournament selection.

Parameters:
averageEvaluation The average evaluation of all chromosomes in the (current) population.
